sentences_texts: we all liked the brunch items we had but when we later asked if the chips were supposed to come with the meal, the waitress explained it away by saying sometimes they forget instead of apologizing and offering something extra.

sentences_texts: One of our diners didn't like her fish and both the waitress and the manager insisted on replacing it.

sentences_texts: Went here with my husband on a Saturday night for dinner since the place looked like it had great atmosphere.

sentences_texts: ' When I called the waitress on it, she said that they simply couldn't serve tap water.
Especially the manager or host who kept walking by and giving us the evil eye to see the progress of our dinner so they could turn the table over to other customers.
sentences_opinions: manager negative <sep> host negative <sep> dinner neutral

sentences_texts: The waiter knew about every item on the menu and explained it very well.
While the staff was kind and attentive, our waiter never once broke a smile, even when I told him it was my friend's birthday, although he did bring a dessert with a candle at the end of the meal.
sentences_opinions: staff positive <sep> waiter positive <sep> dessert neutral <sep> candle neutral <sep> meal neutral

sentences_texts: We were however seated right away and was immediately told by our waiter that they were out of sparking mineral water.
So we showed up with our reservations and even though the place stayed pretty empty throughout the night, they seated us right next to the swinging kitchen doors.
Also, overheard gent at the next table complaining to the manager about his food.
sentences_opinions: table neutral <sep> manager negative <sep> food negative

sentences_texts: Although I didn't pay for the meal (and it's about $22 bucks a plate, way over my normal eating range), I have to say that it was better than any food I've ever had in little Italy, and there weren't any touristy elements to be found.
The server was so busy the night we visited that she forgot to put in our food order.
There are no price listed in the menu, and she will not provid them with a smile.
When I couldn't hear any of my selections in the dining room, the manager told me that the broken speakers in were 'not his fault'
Our waitress did not take our drink order until I finally flagged her down and even then she seemed disinterested in our meal.
sentences_opinions: waitress negative <sep> drink neutral <sep> meal negative

sentences_texts: i got a steak special that was way overpriced ($12 more then the steak on the menu and no warning from the waitress) and it was cooked to the wrong temperature.
sentences_opinions: steak special negative <sep> menu neutral <sep> waitress negative <sep> temperature negative

sentences_texts: We finally flagged down another server who brought us more to drink, and then they took forever with the check.
When we asked a waiter for an explanation of the long wait with some many empty tables he had no answer so we asked for the manager.
sentences_opinions: waiter negative <sep> tables neutral <sep> manager neutral

sentences_texts: service was attentive at the beginning but the waiter lost us towards the end and we had to flag them down for the check.

The place was packed and while our food took time to be prepared, our waiter earned points for his sparkling conversation to pass time and for also knowing practically every ingredient of every special under consideration.
Our waitress was a bit cold but she was still attentive and food came quickly.
However, when our waitress realized her faux pas, an extra glass of wine was sent to our table and all was forgiven.
sentences_opinions: waitress negative <sep> glass of wine neutral <sep> table neutral

sentences_texts: Our waiter was a little stressed and brought a couple things out late and as a result, he apologized graciously and gave us wine on the house to compensate for the delay.
The space is grand with a very high ceiling although it is one of those places that they keep so dark you are not really sure what you are eating anyway.
The service was non-existant, the manager spent all of his time at the bar.
sentences_opinions: service negative <sep> manager negative <sep> bar neutral

sentences_texts: I'd recommend getting an appetizer b/c the dinner takes a bit to be cooked, but it was definitely worth the wait.
very nice servers, but they seemed more interested in conversing with the regulars than bringing food and being attentive.
A friend of mine and I bumped into this restaurant last week and it didn't look like any special place on the outside, but when we looked at the menu we decided to give it a try.
I told the waiter that my drink tasted very bad and asked if he could swap it out for a Petron Margarita.
The manager claimed that he could not compensate us for anything on the bill which just shows the lack of sophistication from the entire group.
Our waitress was very nice, not snotty - she even gave us a free apertif after the meal (and left the bottle on the table).
The piano guy isn't there all the time, but when he is it's a great addition to the meal.
Asked for wine recommendations and the waitress told me her favorites and described them in detail - I don't encounter this much in NYC.
It took 1 1/4 hours to get our appetizers (how long does salad take) and when we complained to the manager, he barely listened.
sentences_opinions: appetizers neutral <sep> salad neutral <sep> manager negative

sentences_texts: The food was pretty good, but due to our large size (~16) the manager asked us to limit our appetizers to just 3 selections b/c he didn't want to overburden his cooks.
The waiters have been there for YEARS and they know their steak is amazing.
Our waiter never once asked how everything was, as I suspect he knew the kitchen was producing seriously average food.
sentences_opinions: waiter negative <sep> kitchen neutral <sep> food negative

sentences_texts: When I asked the manager to remove the coffee, she did so without question, but never asked why and never followed up on the issue (she was far too busy flirting with the male waiters).
sentences_opinions: manager negative <sep> coffee neutral <sep> waiters neutral
